title: Canadian Negotiators Race to Avoid Border Snarl for Trade, U.S. Tourists
summary: As Friday deadline looms, mediator works with agency officials, union for customs and immigration officers. OTTAWA-Talks under a mediator's watch continued late Thursday between Canada and the union representing its border agents to head off a labor action starting Friday that threatens the flow of U.S.-Canada trade and a plan to allow American tourists to visit for the first time in 16 months.

title: 'Ping': The Sound of Alarm, From Muskets to Pandemics
summary: The evocative name for the sound of a ricocheting bullet has become an all-purpose alert. Linguist and lexicographer Ben Zimmer analyzes the origins of words in the news. Read previous columns here.

title: Cuomo Impeachment Probe Sets Deadline for Governor Response
summary: New York state lawmakers tell governor he has until Aug. 13 to submit evidence in his defense. ALBANY, N.Y.-Officials in the New York state Assembly said Thursday that their impeachment investigation of Gov. Andrew Cuomo is nearing completion and set an Aug. 13 deadline for him to submit evidence in his defense.

title: New York's Capital Is Crazytown
summary: The report on Cuomo finds credible allegations of sexual harassment-and a deep weirdness.. Let's stop for a second to reflect on the state attorney general's report in the case of Andrew Cuomo. I have read the 165 pages. It is a narrative about charges of sexual harassment that investigators found credible, and that were more numerous than expected. But there is a real Crazytown aspect to the story.

title: Biden's Drive for the Future
summary: Manufacturers, unions and environmental groups join him to promote zero-emitting vehicles and the benefits they'll provide.. Sometimes it isn't what you say but who'll stand with you when you say it. On Thursday President Biden stood alongside the leaders of the big three U.S. auto makers and the president of the United Auto Workers as he announced his goal that half of all new cars sold by 2030 would produce no tailpipe pollution and directed the Environmental Protection Agency to begin developing new standards for cars, trucks and buses. The Biden administration has unified manufacturers, labor and environmental groups behind a common purpose: to accelerate the manufacturing of zero-emitting vehicles and the economic, health and climate benefits they will provide.

title: Richard Trumka, Longtime AFL-CIO Leader, Dies
summary: President of nation's largest union organization was vocal supporter of Democrats and helped shape labor policy. Richard Trumka, the president of the AFL-CIO, the nation's largest labor federation, died Thursday at the age of 72.

title: Biden Breaks Some More China
summary: The U.S. offers refuge to Hong Kongers afraid to return home.. The sad reality for any President watching Beijing dismantle a free and vibrant Hong Kong is that the outside world has few options to stop it. So kudos to President Biden for finding one that at least delivers relief to those in personal jeopardy.

title: The Electric Vehicle Welfare State
summary: Car makers back the Biden climate agenda in return for subsidies and higher consumer prices.. What a spectacle. We're referring to the political advertisement that auto makers staged with President Biden on Thursday endorsing the Administration's stricter fuel-economy rules and climate agenda. Behold Big Business colluding with Big Government to grab subsidies and raise consumer prices.

title: Abolishing ICE From the Inside
summary: Biden's nominee has a history of hampering the agency he'd lead.. The Biden Administration is tweaking the dials of its border policies to slow the flow of migrants this summer. Yet its long-term commitment to lax enforcement seems as fixed as ever. One example is the nomination of a top immigration officer whose main qualification is hampering the agency he's been tapped to lead.

summary: Resume Subscription. Greenville, a small town about 115 miles northeast of Sacramento, was ravaged by the Dixie Fire on Wednesday night, as wildfires continue to sweep through California.

title: Could the Covid Vaccine (and Others) Prevent Alzheimer's?
summary: There's growing evidence that inoculation confers significant protective benefits.. Covid vaccines enormously reduce the risk of death and hospitalization in those who have been infected by the novel coronavirus. But could they also help protect seniors against dementia and Alzheimer's disease? There's reason to hope so.

title: Move the Olympics to Athens-Forever
summary: Why not eliminate the selection process that feeds nationalism?. I'm a proud Greek-American, and the Olympics have a special place in my heart. Every couple of years, the world is treated to a spectacular display of athletic ability in summer and winter formats at a carefully selected national venue.

title: Notable & Quotable: Richard Trumka
summary: 'A guy who got up everyday and built the best car that he could, how is he at fault?'. From the Journal's Sept. 19, 2009, Weekend Interview with AFL-CIO President Richard Trumka, who died Thursday at 72:

title: Have No Illusions About the U.S. Withdrawal From Afghanistan
summary: The Taliban doesn't care about human rights any more than they did in 2001 and likely will take power.. Is Afghanistan destined to return to barbarism? Some hope that the hasty and haphazard U.S. withdrawal won't lead to Taliban rule or that the jihadist group will govern more gently than before. That optimism is misplaced, and the disaster likely to come will have global consequences.

title: 'The Icepick Surgeon' Review: Bad Medicine
summary: If your child were freezing to death, would you ignore the data about lifesaving techniques because they were gathered unethically?. At first he felt only cold, as near-freezing water rushed in up to his neck. Soon cold became pain. Inch by inch, his body froze, the blood receding from his extremities, his nerves sending excruciating messages to his brain. With his head kept above water, he couldn't even count on the blessed insensibility that comes with drowning. At last he begged to be shot. Instead, he and other "patients" like him were put through a series of bizarre warming therapies, from ambient blanket wraps to alcohol ingestion, skin contact and hot baths. If he survived, he would be forced to undergo the procedure again, for he was a research subject of SS chief Heinrich Himmler, architect of the Holocaust and a number of unfathomably brutal medical experiments.

title: The GOP's Bad Infrastructure Deal
summary: The bill is filled with financial gimmicks, waste and expansions of Washington power.. It isn't just the Biden administration that is keen to redefine the term "infrastructure." A growing number of Republican senators are getting in on the act, and more fool the party.

title: Zynga Warns Pandemic Lift Is Ending for Videogame Companies
summary: Easing of Covid-19 pandemic restrictions has started to bite game publishers. Zynga Inc., the mobile game company behind franchises such as FarmVille, said its audience declined more than it expected late in the second quarter, and the company lowered its full-year forecast for bookings, a key indicator of sales.

title: Novavax Delays Seeking U.S. Approval for Covid-19 Vaccine
summary: The shot, which can be stored at normal refrigerator temperatures, could provide much-needed boost to global vaccination efforts. Novavax Inc. said it would delay seeking U.S. emergency authorization for its Covid-19 vaccine until the fourth quarter as it works to complete the manufacturing portion of its application.

title: EU Takes Another Step to Harmonize Anti-Money-Laundering Rules
summary: European Banking Authority proposes guidance for financial-sector compliance officers, part of a wider revamp of how the bloc deals with money laundering. The European Union's banking regulator has proposed guidance for financial-sector compliance officers, another step in the bloc's effort to revamp its anti-money-laundering system.

title: L'Oréal's New Digital Chief Takes Cosmetics Virtual
summary: Asmita Dubey is exploring how online games, augmented reality and social media can help the French cosmetics company reach new demographics. L'Oréal Group's newly appointed digital executive is exploring how online games, augmented reality and social media can help the French cosmetics company reach new demographics amid an expected increase in e-commerce sales.

title: Biden Lays Down Marker on Fuel Efficiency, Electric Vehicles
summary: General Motors, Ford and Stellantis agree to voluntary electric-vehicle sales target but say push needs federal funding. WASHINGTON-President Biden made dual moves to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, imposing tougher fuel-efficiency standards on auto makers and challenging them to drastically ramp up sales of electric vehicles by 2030.

title: 'Our Town' Review: Everybody's Town
summary: Peterborough Players presents Thornton Wilder's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, staged outdoors in the village where it came into being. Peterborough, N.H.

title: SEC Chief Braces for Clash With Crypto Traders
summary: Gensler wants to regulate digital assets to the same extent as stocks, bonds and commodity-related trading instruments. Securities and Exchange Commission Chairman Gary Gensler this week declared war on what he called the Wild West of crypto trading, promising a vigorous attack on fraud and misconduct. But progress is likely to be more piecemeal and incremental than wholesale and sudden.

title: 'Nadia Boulanger and Her World' Review: The Mother of Contemporary Classical
summary: This year, the Bard Musical Festival is dedicating its programming to the life and work of the pedagogue, composer and musician.. Always adventuresome and provocative, the Bard Music Festival has been examining major composers for three decades. But unlike previous Bard laureates, this year's subject-the revered French musician and pedagogue Nadia Boulanger (1887-1979)-is virtually unknown as a composer. Her few compositions, beautiful as they are, have rarely been performed.

title: 'John and the Hole' Review: Serious Growing Pains
summary: Coming-of-age story meets psychological thriller in this film about a 13-year-old boy who traps his family in a bunker, adapted from a short story by Nicolás Giacobone..

title: Rolling Stones Drummer Charlie Watts Will Likely Miss 'No Filter' Tour
summary: Longtime drummer, recovering from an unspecified medical issue, will be replaced on tour by Steve Jordan, who has collaborated with Keith Richards. Rolling Stones drummer Charlie Watts is unlikely to perform with his bandmates when they resume their "No Filter" tour, as he recovers from a medical issue, the band shared in a statement.

title: Cryptocurrency Compromise Emerges for Infrastructure Bill
summary: Biden-backed provision aims to boost tax enforcement on crypto transactions. WASHINGTON-A key senator negotiating the roughly $1 trillion bipartisan infrastructure bill signaled a willingness to compromise over a provision that seeks to raise money through tougher tax enforcement of cryptocurrency transactions.

title: Stocks Rise as Jobless Claims Drop
summary: S&P 500 moved higher on data showing unemployment-benefits applications decreased and trade deficit widened. Stocks rallied broadly, as shares of banks and technology and travel companies rose.

title: Britney Spears Files Request to Move Up Conservatorship Hearing Date
summary: The singer's new lawyer, Mathew Rosengart, is acting quickly in an attempt to remove her father James Spears from the arrangement. Britney Spears's lawyer is moving swiftly in an attempt to remove her father, James Spears, from the conservatorship that has ruled her life and finances for the past 13 years.

title: Bestselling Books Week Ended July 31
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: Robinhood Stock Drops After News of Early Investors Set to Sell Shares
summary: The investing platform won't receive the proceeds from the sales. Robinhood Markets Inc. shares fell 28% Thursday after a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission indicated that early investors in the company can sell up to about 98 million shares, currently valued at almost $5 billion, over time.

title: Apple's Plans to Have iPhones Detect Child Pornography Fuel Debate
summary: The system will use new techniques in cryptography, artificial intelligence to identify child sexual abuse material. Apple Inc. plans to introduce new iPhone software designed to identify and report collections of sexually exploitative images of children, aiming to bridge the yearslong divide between the company's pledge to protect customer privacy and law enforcement's desire to learn of illegal activity happening on the device.

title: FDA Vaccine Booster Plan Could Be Ready Within Weeks
summary: Extra shots are being weighed as a way to extend protection against the coronavirus as worrisome variants spread. The Food and Drug Administration expects to have a strategy on Covid-19 vaccine boosters by early September that would lay out when and which vaccinated individuals should get the follow-up shots, according to people familiar with discussions within the agency.

title: CNN Fires Three Staffers Who Came to Work Unvaccinated Against Covid-19
summary: Network chief Jeff Zucker also said the company's official return-to-office date will be postponed. CNN President Jeff Zucker told staff Thursday that the network fired three employees who came to work without getting a Covid-19 vaccine, as the company steps up efforts to keep the virus from spreading in its offices.

title: Manchin Says Fed Should Reverse Easy-Money Policies
summary: West Virginia Democrat asks Chairman Jerome Powell to cease bond buying amid inflation worries. WASHINGTON-Sen. Joe Manchin (D., W.Va.) raised alarms about inflation in a letter to Fed Chairman Jerome Powell on Thursday, calling on the central bank to start reversing the emergency support it has provided during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Coal Is a Gold Mine for Producers After Blistering Rally
summary: Thermal-coal miner Glencore reported record first-half earnings and expects the fuel to be a big moneymaker for the rest of the year. Miners are printing money from a business many are trying to exit: digging up thermal coal.

title: Weber's Shares Rise in Debut After IPO Targets Slashed
summary: Stock climbs 18% on first day of trading. Weber Inc. shares rose on their first day of trading Thursday, a positive sign for the grill maker a day after it priced its IPO below expectations and slashed the number of shares being sold.

title: Justice Department Opens Probe Into Phoenix Police Department
summary: Civil-rights investigation to focus on police practices in the Arizona city, including possible violations of rights of homeless people. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department launched a broad civil-rights investigation into the practices of the Phoenix Police Department, including whether officers routinely violate the rights of homeless people in the Arizona capital, officials said Thursday.

title: AIG Swings to Profit on Private-Equity Investments, Premium-Rate Increases
summary: The global insurance conglomerate was helped by absence of pandemic-related charges. American International Group Inc. swung to a second-quarter profit, aided by heady gains in its private-equity investments and the absence of Covid-19-related charges.

title: Everyone Else Gets Fed Up
summary: U.K. inflation leaves policy makers in a bind if the U.S. Federal Reserve won't act, too.. Of all the central bankers in the world, we'd least like to be Andrew Bailey of the Bank of England. His unenviable task is figuring out how-or whether-to rein in accelerating inflation in the United Kingdom without help from the Federal Reserve or the European Central Bank. Faced with this conundrum, he punted again at a Thursday policy meeting.

title: Three Little Words (Friday Crossword, August 6)
Moderna Recommends Covid-19 Vaccine Booster to Protect Against New Variants
summary: Company said vaccine sales rose above $4 billion in the latest quarter and that it signed $20 billion worth of advanced purchase agreements for 2021. Moderna Inc. said Thursday it expects people who received its two-dose Covid-19 vaccine to need a booster shot in the fall to keep strong protection against newer variants of the coronavirus.

title: Kipikpa
summary: This simple sauce is delicious on grilled or barbecued chicken, pork, beef or fish. To explore and search through all our recipes, check out the new WSJ Recipes page.

title: U.S. Investor Michael Calvey Found Guilty of Embezzlement in Russia
summary: American private-equity chief's 2019 arrest shook foreign business community, further strained U.S.-Russia relations. MOSCOW-A Russian court found American private-equity investor Michael Calvey guilty of embezzlement more than two years after he was arrested in a case that shook the foreign business community and exacerbated U.S.-Russia tensions.

title: Fauci and the CDC Undermined Public Trust
summary: When clear evidence is lacking, they project their own Covid speculations as authoritative scientific judgments.. In times of public-health emergency, the federal government takes on the role of a provider of information. Unfortunately, as "The CDC's Delta Variant Panic" (Review & Outlook, July 31) illustrates, our government has fallen into a pattern of not only vacillating between contradictory positions, but also fanning the flames of Covid-19 misinformation.

title: This Simple Sauce Recipe Makes Good Grilling Great
summary: From her kitchen in Marseille, Georgiana Viou shares her spicy Kipikpa sauce, plus tips on the West African and southern French ingredients that light up her pantry and wisdom on what makes a meal truly memorable. I'M A WOMAN of the South, or actually many souths," said chef Georgiana Viou. "This is how I explain my cooking to clients at Rouge." That's her new restaurant at the Margaret Hotel Chouleur in Nimes, in southern France. Though she's originally from Benin in Africa, she's made her home in Marseilles (near Nimes) for more than 20 years. "Today I'm as much Marseillaise as I am Beninoise," said Ms. Viou, though she wouldn't describe her cuisine as Afro-Provençale. "I don't do fusion cooking. My cooking is spontaneous, seasonal and very personal."

title: The Fed's Reverse Repos Don't Shrink the Money Supply
summary: The temporary sale of government securities from the Federal Reserve's vast holdings doesn't affect deposit liabilities.. Phil Gramm and Thomas R. Saving introduce their op-ed "How the Fed Is Hedging Its Inflation Bet" (Aug. 2) by stating a fact: "The growth of the M2 money stock fell from around 25% in 2020 to around 10% on an annualized basis in the first six months of 2021." They then proceed to explain that this deceleration has occurred because the Fed has been able to drain "almost a trillion dollars of liquidity out of the financial system" since April via its reverse-repurchase facility. Their argument rests on faulty theory and doesn't hold water.

title: Don't Fall for the Oil Lobby's Change of Heart on Climate
summary: Words aside, Big Oil is doing all it can to maintain the status quo.. The goal of the American Petroleum Institute is to maintain our reliance on oil and gas. To expect its help passing effective legislation on climate change is a misplaced expectation ("Oil Lobby Shifted on Climate Policy, and Won Few Friends," Page One, July 29). The leadership's statement of support for carbon pricing is a response to growing pressure, but as an organization it is doing all it can to maintain the status quo.

title: Safe Driving Doesn't Have to Mean Slower Driving
summary: The maximum safe speed varies greatly with the character of a street.. One letter ("Traffic Laws and Societies That Flout Them," Aug. 4) criticizes the Transportation Committee of the New York state Assembly for refusing to bring safety-promoting bills to the floor. I don't dispute the need for safer driving and compliance with traffic laws. But what's holding up the committee members is likely the uncompromising nature of the proposed laws. The best example is Sammy's Law, which would allow New York City to lower the speed limit to 20 miles per hour on all streets, even wide boulevards.

title: Covid Restrictions for Americans, None for Illegal Immigrants
summary: Protect the border to protect U.S. citizens from the virus.. What spreads faster, Covid or hypocrisy? I couldn't agree more with Jason Riley: "If Biden Is Serious About Covid, He'll Protect the Border" (Upward Mobility, Aug. 4). New York City is requiring proof of vaccination for everything from dining out to going to the gym. The CDC recommends masking for schoolchildren. They impose restrictions on Americans while illegal immigrants are coming over the border, not tested, kept in crowded spaces and then sent to cities where they can spread the virus.

title: Let Slip the Dogs, Birds and Donkeys of War
summary: Animals have served human militaries with distinction since ancient times. Historian Amanda Foreman searches the past for the origins of today's world. Read previous columns here.

title: Cori Bush Put Life Story to Work in Eviction Protest at Capitol
summary: Resume Subscription. WASHINGTON-President Biden insisted that the only way to extend an expiring eviction moratorium was for Congress to pass a new law. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D., Calif.) said that the only way was through the executive branch.

title: Texas GOP Governor Calls Second Special Session to Pass Voting Bill
summary: Democrats who fled to Washington, D.C., to block passage of curbs on voter access haven't yet said if they will return. AUSTIN, Texas- Texas Gov. Greg Abbott called Thursday for a second special session to pass voting legislation, after state Democrats torpedoed the current special session by fleeing to Washington, D.C.

title: Covid-19 Vaccination Rates Rise Where Delta Variant Is Spreading
summary: More people are getting shots in Southern and Midwestern states; 'Don't wait until Covid comes knocking'. Covid-19 vaccination rates are ticking upward across the U.S., federal officials said, particularly in areas where the Delta variant is hitting hardest.

title: Iran Swears In New President as Unease Grows in West
summary: Inauguration consolidates Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei's control over the Islamic Republic. For the first time in years, all branches of power in Iran are under the control of hard-liners after a protégé of the supreme leader was sworn in as president, bolstering their power and adding to growing unease that the Islamic Republic's relations with the West could worsen.

title: Auto Insurers Face Bumpy Road Ahead
summary: As people return to normal driving habits, insurers are seeing more accident losses-but they are also starting to look toward higher rates, too. People are driving more, but many of them may also still be paying less for their car insurance.

title: Amazon Delays Return to Office to 2022
summary: Online retail giant is latest business to adjust return-to-work plans amid concerns about Delta variant. Amazon.com Inc. said it would delay corporate employees' return to offices until next year as conditions around the Covid-19 pandemic evolve.

title: FASB Mirrors IRS Rules for Valuing Shares Tied to Equity Pay for Private Firms
summary: Nonpublic companies can opt to provide one valuation instead of two for accounting and tax requirements. The U.S. accounting standard setter is aligning its rules for how private companies measure the value of shares tied to stock options and other forms of equity compensation with those of the Internal Revenue Service, a move aimed at reducing the burden on businesses.

title: Qualcomm Bids $4.6 Billion for Veoneer as Its New CEO Looks Beyond iPhone
summary: The offer comes two weeks after Veoneer agreed to merge with Magna International. Qualcomm Inc. has made a $4.6 billion offer to buy auto-technology company Veoneer Inc., moving to outbid Magna International Inc. as the semiconductor company's new chief seeks to expand beyond the core mobile-phone chip business.

title: Penn National Agrees to Buy TheScore App in $2 Billion Deal
summary: Move by gaming company adds sports news and technology to help enhance customer experience. Penn National Gaming Inc. agreed to acquire Score Media & Gaming Inc. for about $2 billion, adding sports news and digital technology to its sports-betting operations.

title: China's Corporate Crackdown Is Just Getting Started. Signs Point to More Tumult Ahead.
summary: Regulators are pushing companies to do more to serve the Communist Party's goals, rattling markets. In recent months, China has blown up what would have been the world's largest initial public offering, launched probes into some of its biggest technology companies, and wiped out more than $1 trillion in market value while investors scramble for cover.

title: A Level Playing Field for Transgender Athletes
summary: To balance fairness and inclusion in elite sports, Olympic officials can look to the precedents they set when they assessed the advantages of prosthetic limbs. Two openly transgender women have competed in the Tokyo Olympics, in the women's division of their sports: New Zealand weightlifter Laurel Hubbard, in the +87kg weight class, and Stephanie Barrett, a Canadian archer. Their participation has met with criticism from those who view biological sex as the relevant criteria for whether someone can compete fairly in the women's category.

title: Exxon Considers Pledging 'Net Zero' Carbon by 2050
summary: Chief Executive Darren Woods faces pressure from investors to take a more decisive approach to reducing emissions. Exxon Mobil Corp. is considering a pledge to reduce its net carbon emissions to zero by 2050, according to people familiar with the matter, in what would amount to a significant strategic shift by the oil company.

title: First Apartment? 5 Tips to Make It Instagram-Worthy
summary: Professionals say young people setting up their own digs-as are many post-pandemic-tend to make similar decorating errors. Here's what to do instead.. AFTER 16 MONTHS cooped up with roommates or parents, young (and not-so-young) people have had enough. Those who can afford it are increasingly moving into their own first places when their leases end this summer and fall, said a spokesman for real-estate rental site StreetEasy. Searches that specified studio apartments are up 69% year-over-year.

title: U.S. Trade Deficit Widened to Record in June, Showing Strong Pre-Delta Demand
summary: Jobless claims remained elevated last week after steady declines. WASHINGTON-The U.S. trade deficit widened to a record in June as the resurgent American economy drove strong demand for foreign-made goods ahead of the Covid-19 Delta-variant surge.

title: Moody's to Buy RMS in Bid to Boost Climate Risk Business
summary: The $2 billion deal is a sign of the money to be made from selling data that analyzes changing climate patterns. Moody's Corp. , best known for rating corporate and government debt, is diving into disaster and climate-change risk modeling.

title: Chabad Ministers to 'Jews of No Religion'
summary: Chapters at nearly 200 campuses engage with the young and assimilated.. While the future of the Jewish people is uncertain, Jews can always count on Pew for provocative, and sometimes depressing, statistics about themselves.

title: WPP Raises Revenue Forecast as Clients Boost Digital Spending
summary: Advertising company reports growth across sectors and regions as it recovers from the Covid-19 pandemic. Advertising company WPP PLC said it returned to pre-pandemic growth rates a year earlier than expected as clients boosted spending on digital marketing and e-commerce.

title: Climate Change Doesn't Cause All Disasters
summary: Warming annually causes about 120,000 heat deaths but prevents nearly 300,000 cold deaths.. Everybody talks about the weather, but nobody does anything about it. That old quip, often attributed to Mark Twain or his friend Charles Dudley Warner, now guides most news coverage of severe weather. The media say that natural disasters are a result of climate change and we need to adopt radical policies to combat them.

title: In Salt Lake City, 'Sticker Shock' Isn't Stopping People From Buying Million-Dollar Homes
summary: The luxury market is outpacing the rest of the Utah city's single-family home market, as out-of-state buyers snap up homes priced at $1 million and up. During their months stuck at home, some people may have fantasized about escaping to Hawaii. Katie Goates, a 39-year-old homemaker from Los Altos, Calif., spent her Hawaiian escape fantasizing about Salt Lake City, Utah.

summary: The latest NFIB survey finds a historic labor shortage.. Unfilled job openings hit another record high at U.S. small firms in July, according to the National Federation of Independent Business. Proving once again that markets work, the percentage of company owners planning to raise compensation also set a new record in the latest NFIB survey due out later today.

summary: Resume Subscription. The pandemic-fueled market has come to this: A Southern California compound with an unfinished main house is asking $33.95 million.

title: Cuba Sings Its Political Story
summary: "Patria y Vida," this summer's protest anthem, belongs to the rich tradition of an island nation where music and politics have long intertwined. .. 'Patria y Vida," a reggaeton anthem produced by Cuban artists both at home and in exile, makes no secret of its purpose: "We represent the dignity of an entire people who have been crushed at gunpoint and by meaningless words," the lyrics declaim. "No more lies. My country asks for liberty, no more doctrines.'"

title: What's the Ideal Asset Mix in Retirement? Is It 70/30? 60/40?
summary: Here's one way to think about it so that you get the returns you need-and the risk level you can tolerate. My wife and I are approaching retirement, and our financial adviser is recommending that we put about 70% of our nest egg in stocks and about 30% in bonds. This approach seems risky to me. Is it? My preferred mix is about 60/40.

title: U.S. Taps Amazon, Google, Microsoft, Others to Help Fight Ransomware, Cyber Threats

title: FAA Asks Airports to Help Deal With Surge in Unruly Passengers
summary: The agency wants to take a more aggressive approach to punishing traveler misbehavior as it is inundated with reports of out-of-control people. The Federal Aviation Administration said it wants airports to help tamp down bad behavior by travelers.

title: How to Create a Garden That Pleases the Whole Family
summary: With a vegetable patch for the home chef and playful pathways for the kids, copious flowers for the aesthete and comfy perches where all can lounge, this California garden checks all the boxes. Here's how it came together.. THERE WAS was nothing you could call a yard," recalled landscape designer Janell Denler Hobart of first visiting the San Anselmo, Calif., site where her clients, a young family, had recently bought a residence. The home's main entrance opened onto a hillside that was extremely steep and utterly barren, said the designer, whose firm, Denler Hobart Gardens, is located in nearby Ross, Calif. "I think most people would have looked at it and thought 'What can you possibly do here?'"

title: How Do You Withdraw Money From '529' Plans? (And Other Questions From Readers)

summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-The U.S. men's track team's afternoon started with getting chewed out by American track legend Carl Lewis on Twitter. Its day ended with two U.S. hopefuls missing the podium in the men's 400 meters.

title: Robinhood Insiders Sell More Shares: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: Robinhood looks set to give up some of Wednesday's gains when the market opens. U.S. stock futures are edging higher and a recent bout of frenzied trading of Robinhood Markets looks set to fade on its plan to sell more shares. Here's what we're watching ahead of Thursday's open.

title: U.S. Women's Soccer Team Ends Olympics With Bronze
summary: Resume Subscription. KASHIMA, Japan-The star-studded U.S. women's soccer team was frustrated after struggling in Olympic play and losing its semifinal against Canada. So its stars gathered without coaches to hash things out.

title: USA Basketball's Not-So-Perfect Strangers
summary: Resume Subscription. SAITAMA, Japan-The U.S. men's basketball team was less than 24 hours from its first game of the Olympics and still waiting. Three of its most important players hadn't even arrived in Japan.

title: Airlines' Summer Conundrum: Don't Fly or Fly to the Same Places
summary: Lufthansa's budget arm is doing better than its flagship airline, but low-cost operators still face stiff competition to fly a small number of unrestricted routes. European investors who want to fly to Greek beaches this summer probably have more options than ever before. That is a reason to think twice before buying shares in the airlines taking them there.

title: House Noises Can Be Normal, Abnormal or Even Paranormal. How to Tell the Difference
summary: That creak you heard could be an intruder, or even a ghost. But it could be the foundation settling, too.. All aging houses make noises. They're like elderly relatives who can't sit or stand without grunting, moaning or cracking. Some house noises are scary. Most noises are totally benign. Some noises signal the presence of intruders or ghosts. The trick to owning a home is learning to recognize the unique sounds that it makes. That way, when some new weird noise starts up, you'll know there is something amiss. That something could be a furnace about to explode, or it could be a bad guy sneaking up your cellar stairs.

title: Isabella Rossellini Is Betting the Farm
summary: Eight years after founding a private, organic farm in Brookhaven, N.Y., the actress and her daughter, Elettra Wiedemann, invite visitors for an overnight stay on their bucolic property.. "My slogan is 'Make America Small Again!'" says actor and philanthropist Isabella Rossellini, 69, who runs the organic farm and boutique inn Mama Farm in the hamlet of Brookhaven, New York, with her daughter, Elettra Wiedemann, 38, a former food editor and model. "Small businesses, mom-and-pop shops, artisanal farms-when things become too big you can't wrap your head around it."

title: Beijing Cancels August Events, Citing Delta
summary: Cancellations are latest sign Covid-19 variant is denting economic activity in China. Health authorities in Beijing announced the city would cancel all large-scale exhibitions and events for the remainder of August, according to state media, the latest sign of economic disruption due to the fast-spreading Delta variant.

title: The Dystopian Quarantines That Crushed Olympic Dreams
summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-Ecuador's David Hurtado walked thousands of kilometers on treadmills, tracks and roads lined with snow-capped mountains to prepare for Thursday's 20-kilometer race walk in Sapporo.

title: It Isn't Just the Heat That Makes the Tokyo Olympics So Hot
summary: Resume Subscription. The Tokyo Games have been affected by some of the hottest temperatures in Olympic history, forcing athletes to make extra efforts to cool their bodies and in some cases withdraw from competition. And with medals still to be won in several outdoor endurance events ahead of Sunday's closing ceremony, the heat isn't letting up.

title: The Weirdest Training Site for the Olympics: Europe's Tallest Chimney
summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-Janja Garnbret, a Slovenian climber who has won just about everything there is to win in the sport, prepared like most other athletes for the Tokyo Games: she trained for five hours, six days a week, did yoga and even started to learn Japanese.

title: How Men Should Dress for a First Date in 2021
summary: You're finally leaving your living room and are re-entering the dating market, but those spiffy outfits that served you so well pre-pandemic seem like overkill. Here, expert advice on dressing to connect in 2021.. AFTER A YEAR in my apartment, I've changed my mind on a few things," said Matthew Kehoe, 42, "one of which is dating attire." Mr. Kehoe, a film producer in New York, is among the many single men re-entering the in-person dating game after months of relative isolation. But just as work, travel and socializing have evolved unpredictably since February of 2020, so too has the quest for a mate. That's not necessarily a bad thing.

title: Foxconn to Buy Semiconductor Manufacturing Facility
summary: The world's largest assembler of Apple iPhones says the purchase will help secure a steady supply of auto chips as it expands further into the electric-vehicle industry. Foxconn Technology Group , the world's biggest electronics contract manufacturer, said that it would acquire a semiconductor manufacturing facility, taking the company deeper into the chip business at a time of unprecedented global strain.

title: Delta Variant Increases Demand, Wait Times for Covid-19 Tests
summary: More Americans are being tested as cases rise and places require people to show proof they aren't infected. More Americans are being tested for Covid-19-and waiting longer for results-as virus cases surge and places from offices to concert venues require people to show proof they aren't infected.

title: SPACs Target Emerging Markets as U.S. Competition Mounts
summary: The number of blank-check companies focused on developing countries has almost tripled in 2021 as investors look for better value overseas. Blank-check companies are venturing to far-flung locales such as Brazil, Israel and Turkey to find attractive merger targets these days.

title: Nintendo Needs More Than Flashy Buybacks
summary: A big share buyback will help cushion the blow from disappointing results, but isn't a strategy for the future. A surprise share buyback from Japanese gaming champion Nintendo should help soothe investors who have held on as the stock dropped more than 10% this year.

title: 'All Things Must Pass' by George Harrison Review: An Enlightening Remix
summary: The Beatles guitarist's most enduring solo album-tweaked and repackaged with bonus material-sounds better than ever at 50-plus.

title: Roku Pays to Be a Player
summary: Streaming star's ad business delivers, but shortages remind why hardware still matters. Investors got a painful reminder Wednesday that Roku is still in the hardware business.

title: Blackstone, Other Private-Equity Stocks Catch Fire
summary: The firms and their long-languishing shares are benefiting from current market dynamics such as low interest rates. After years of lackluster performance, shares of private-equity firms have hit their stride.

title: Afghan Air Force Struggles to Stay Aloft as U.S. Leaves and Taliban Advances
summary: Resume Subscription. KABUL-First Lt. Ali Rezaie stood by a gutted Black Hawk helicopter in a hangar at the Afghan Air Force headquarters, explaining why the aircraft is broken and can't be flown.

title: Detroit Area's Hot Job Market Compares With Austin's, but Challenges Remain
summary: Resume Subscription. DETROIT-Hiring in the Motor City region hasn't been this hard for 20 years.

title: New Hacking Group Shows Similarities to Gang That Attacked Colonial Pipeline
summary: BlackMatter's cryptocurrency wallets, ransomware strain are similar to those employed by DarkSide, analysts say. Experts who track the actions of cybercriminal gangs say a new hacking group that has emerged recently is using techniques that are similar to the DarkSide group that successfully hacked the Colonial Pipeline Co. earlier this year.

title: Contractor Says Fired Supreme Court Justice Behind Killing of Haitian President
summary: Man who hired Colombian mercenaries says they were accompanying police to execute an arrest warrant on the president, but found him dead. A Miami-based security contractor who hired Colombian mercenaries accused of killing Haitian President Jovenel Moïse last month said he was working with a former Haitian Supreme Court judge to help arrest Mr. Moïse and not assassinate him.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Texas Van Crash Leaves at Least 10 Dead
summary: Twenty survivors, believed to be migrants, have serious to critical injuries. An overloaded van carrying 29 migrants crashed Wednesday on a remote South Texas highway, killing at least 10 people, including the driver, and injuring 20 others, authorities said.

title: GM Reveals Hit From Chip Shortage, Rising Costs
summary: Auto maker's raised profit outlook disappoints investors expecting more, sending its stock price lower. General Motors Co. posted strong second-quarter earnings and raised its full-year profit guidance but said the lingering computer-chip shortage and rising commodity costs would weigh on second-half results.

title: Legal Battle Looms Over New Eviction Moratorium
summary: Biden administration faces high legal hurdles in pressing for new ban without legislation to back it up. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration's latest eviction moratorium is set to face an immediate and possibly fast-moving legal challenge that could present high hurdles for the White House.

title: Who Assassinated Haiti's President? The Mystery Gets Murkier
summary: Resume Subscription. PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti-After he climbed the bloodstained staircase, Carl Henry Destin found a baffling scene.

title: The Books of 'The White Lotus': a Sharp Satire of What Rich People Read
summary: The art of the braggy beach book: Malcolm Gladwell, Nietzsche and others become pitch-perfect props on the HBO show. In HBO's dark comedy The White Lotus, one character doesn't survive a Hawaiian resort vacation. But while the whodunit unfolds, you might be gripped by something slightly less sinister: what everyone is reading by the pool.

title: Weber IPO Prices Below Expectations
summary: Company sold 18 million shares at $14 apiece ahead of its Thursday trading debut. Grill maker Weber Inc. sold fewer shares at a lower price than expected in its initial public offering, people familiar with the matter said, the latest sign the new-issue market may be cooling after a torrid run this summer.

title: Hootsuite Acquires Heyday for $48 Million
summary: Purchase marks second acquisition this year for the social-media marketing platform. Hootsuite Inc., a social-media marketing platform, said it is acquiring Heyday Technologies Inc., an artificial-intelligence company that offers chatbots, for $48 million.
